page.title: 03AN IMMIGRANT VIEW OF BURTON
page.content: Ahmed came from Rawalpindi, Pakistan, when he was twelve years old, not through poverty, but because his parents were already here. He settled down very easily in Britain,and speaks English very well, although his wife has trouble with the language. He got work easily, and gets on well with his work-mates. Ahmed feels close to English people, and finds no trouble with racism. His neighbours, in fact,are Germans! Burton Â£is a very quiet town' - just a place to live, although he feels quite at home here. The family eat English food, although they have a largely vegetarian diet unless the meat is killed in the Muslim way. He would go back to Pakistan Â£if he won the pools'.
